title: Supreme Court Justices Question IRS Shield in Tax-Shelter Case
sub_head: Case involves requirement that taxpayers and advisers disclose certain questionable transactions when filing returns
body:
WASHINGTON—Supreme Court justices sharply questioned arguments by the federal government that certain tax regulations can’t be challenged in court before they are enforced.
Justices across the ideological spectrum, including Samuel Alito, Stephen Breyer, Elena Kagan and Neil Gorsuch, expressed skepticism about the government’s position during an hour-long oral argument Tuesday.
